intro: Pleurolobus maculatus, commonly known as the spotted pleurolobus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
